original_title: Sri Lanka to bowl first against West Indies, debut for Sahan Arachchige
original_body_lines: Sri Lanka won the toss and elected to bowl first in their final Super Six match of the ICC Cricket World Cup Qualifier tournament against the West Indies.

Having already made the finals of the tournamenet, and by extension the Cricket World Cup in October, Sri Lanka have opted to rest Wanindu Hasaranga and Dhananjaya de Silva, with Dushan Hemantha coming into the team and Sahan Arachchige being given an international debut.

Sri Lanka XI: Pathum Nissanka, Dimuth Karunaratne, Kusal Mendis (wk), Sadeera Samarawickrama, Charith Asalanka, Sahan Arachchige, Dasun Shanaka (c), Dushan Hemantha, Maheesh Theekshana, Matheesha Pathirana, Dilshan Madushanka
West Indies XI: Brandon King, Johnson Charles, Keacy Carty, Shai Hope (c & wk), Nicholas Pooran, Shamarh Brooks, Kyle Mayers, Roston Chase, Kevin Sinclair, Romario Shepherd, Akeal Hosein
